biography.content: Mr. Erik Sullivan was born and raised in Prince George, British Columbia where he attended University of Northern British Columbia for one year before transferring to the University of Alberta (U of A) in Edmonton, Alberta. He graduated in 2012 with a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Alberta with distinction.  He is now a senior Master’s of Science student in the department of Mechanical Engineering studying energy interactions between wild land forest fires and buildings utilizing heat conduction theory. He is also a teaching assistant for the U of A and enjoys interacting with students and sharing his knowledge of engineering fundamentals as well as industrial experience in the oil & gas industry. He strives to create a great learning experience for undergraduate students and prepare them for a successful career in industry. Since 2012, his work has resulted in a conference article, two industrial reports and two peer-reviewed journal articles under review.
